title: Peer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Copa  Health
Interview Descriptions: The online application went well but trying to get a hold of a live person was next to impossible and basically I was told to wait for the job fair.

title: Direct Support Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Copa  Health (Mesa, AZ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called the next day to set up an interview. I arrived and they had me fill out an actual application as I had just submitted my resume before. He basically looked over my application, told me the house he was hiring for, asked if I had any questions, and then asked if I could go to HR that day and set everything up. Was not even really an interview. Just seemed like they were desperate and would hire anyone that applied without even finding out about them. When I went to HR they had me sign everything and then right before I left to go get my drug test and fingerprint clearance card I asked something and they said, "Oh by the way, you have to pay for your own drug test, motor vehicle test, and fingerprint card." This should've been explained at the beginning and wouldn't have been had I not asked.
Interview Questions: I can't even remember being asked anything besides my availability and where I lived so they could match me to a close house. Strange interview.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Copa  Health (Cromwell, CT) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I got a call to come in for an in-person interview for their Program/Case Manager position the first week of October 2016. My first in-person interview was with two Vice Presidents in the company on October 21, 2016. The interview went really well, I built a connection with my interviewers and was even given a tour of the facility after I had answered all of their questions. They told me numerous times that they were in a rush to fill the position during this interview.  I didn't hear anything back for two weeks so I called and asked for an update on the hiring process on November 4, 2016.

I was called back on November 9, apologizing for the delay and was asked to come in for a second in-person interview on November 17. This second interview was a panel interview with four people from the company from every level plus a client from one of the programs I would be managing. This second interview went very well I felt, maybe even better than the first one. I answered all of their questions thoughtfully and insightful. I was also given a second tour of the program facility after the interviewed had ended where I got to see the program in action and meet several of the clients.

I didn't hear anything back for weeks and asked for an update or if a decision had been made on 12/2/2016. I was contacted a full week later and said no update had been made and one would be made in the next week, they did not expect the process to take this long. I did not hear anything for one month after this call so I called and asked for yet another update and to just let me know either way if they had a hired for the position or if I was still a candidate. I still did not hear anything from the company until almost two months after the non-update update on 1/21/2017 where I got a non-personalized letter in the mail saying I was not qualified for the position. Throughout this whole process on the company's staff page there had been the Program Manager position listed with no staff picture. This was taken down one day before I got my letter in the mail. 

For future job-seekers be weary of this organization. They dragged my interview process along for almost 5 months for a job I was extremely qualified for and interviewed in-person twice. They never even hired anybody for the position! The lack of communication during this process was appalling, disrespectful, and down-right rude. If a job-seeker is not qualified and or does poorly in the interview process that is one thing but for somebody who met all the qualifications, had a wealth of experiences, and did extremely well in the interviews to get a letter is pretty shameful. But a letter almost 3 months after their second interview saying that they are unqualified for a position that you didn't even hire for and giving them two in person interviews is just abhorrent.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation with a client who refuses to do their job?

title: CLs - Direct Support Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Copa  Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: There are walk in interviews every tuesday. They are at the building at 924 N Country Club Drive. pretty much you get hired on the spot. the interview times are between 9-11. you can do the application online or they had computers there. you don't really need experience to work there but you will need patience with the population you are working with.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience working with the special needs community?

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Copa  Health (Mesa, AZ) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The company will hire any warm body. You do not have to be experienced just capable of following directions and writing brief reports documenting client behavior. It is an underpaid baby sitting job. You have to have a clean driving record to drive company vehicle and no violent background. Depending on your shift you may have to cook food or clean the house. I was hired on the spot because they are understaffed.
